answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!This could be a ciliary flush as seen in conditions like glaucoma, corneal inflammation, iridocyclitis or inflammation around the iris. It can also be due to stagnation of blood flow as seen in peripheral artery disease, common in people with high blood pressure and diabetes. Please consult an eye specialist regarding this. You should get a complete eye examination done. Take care!

question: I am a 48 yr old mother of three who has endured extreme amounts of stress due to my youngest son's medical condition.  About one year ago a friend noticed gray rings around my iris'.  I went to an eye specialist and he said it was something he had only seen in the elderly.  My cholesterol has never been high but that same year I was diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes for which I take medications.  I have been treated for hypertension for about 15 yrs. I am also taking antidepressants  Should I worry about this too?
title: Gray rings around my brown iris'
